intro: Voyria alba, commonly known as the white voyria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and arranged in a dense, compact cluster. Voyria alba thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude ecosystems.
